image.altText: Albanese looks serious, behind him is a dark background

props.synopsis: The prime minister says the conflict in Gaza has stolen "far too many innocent lives", repeating his desire to see a two-state solution after France moved to recognise a Palestinian state.

title.children: PM says Gaza situation 'beyond the world's worst fears'

image.altText: A graphic image of batteries on houses.

props.synopsis: For the first time, battery sales in Australia have surpassed sales of solar panels. Now retail giant Bunnings wants a piece of the action.

title.children: Bunnings makes a play in 'hyper-competitive' solar, battery market

image.altText: A man in a hat and dark suit walks among a pack of reporters outside a court building.

props.synopsis: The NSW government is demanding the immediate resignation of independent MP Gareth Ward, who has been found guilty of sexually abusing two young men.

title.children: Labor demands Gareth Ward resign after conviction for sex crimes

image.altText: A woman wearing a suit leaves a building through sliding glass doors.

props.synopsis: One of the most senior officers in the ranks of Western Australia's police force has been charged with stalking and illegally accessing a computer system.

title.children: One of WA's most senior police officers charged with stalking

image.altText: A woman in white sneakers walking up stairs.

props.synopsis: While many people aim for 10,000 steps a day, new research finds 7,000 daily steps can provide meaningful health improvements and may be a more "realistic" goal.

title.children: Can't hit 10,000 daily steps? 7,000 might be enough, study finds

image.altText: A person walks by a purple building looking at its roof that has fallen in with debris strewn inside it

props.synopsis: The bloodiest military battles in more than a decade between Thailand and Cambodia have reportedly killed at least 16 people — mostly civilians.

title.children: Thailand-Cambodia military exchanges could lead to war, acting Thai PM says

image.altText: A woman with windswept, dark hair wearing a black coat and white blouse turns a street corner with autumn foliage.

props.synopsis: Former Miss Australia and Tasmanian MP Kathryn Hay is sentenced for emotional abuse and intimidation of her former husband Troy Richardson.

title.children: Suspended prison sentence for former Labor MP Kathryn Hay

image.altText: Ghislaine Maxwell in a white shirt, grinning at the camera

props.synopsis: A top US Justice Department official spends hours interviewing Ghislaine Maxwell, the imprisoned accomplice of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, as President Donald Trump struggles to tamp down a furore over his handling of the explosive case.

title.children: Epstein accomplice Ghislaine Maxwell speaks with US Justice Department

image.altText: A screenshot of two people in an intimate embrace looking shocked

props.synopsis: Kristin Cabot was listed on the tech company's website as chief people officer, but her picture has since been removed.

title.children: Astronomer's chief HR officer resigns after Coldplay concert saga

image.altText: An animated devil is in a bed next to an animated Donald Trump

props.synopsis: Just hours after Paramount bought global streaming rights for South Park in a billion-dollar deal, the 27th season opens with President Donald Trump begging Satan for sex.

title.children: South Park airs naked Trump parody as Paramount merges with Skydance

image.altText: A man with a white moustache raises his hand in court

props.synopsis: A 2016 civil trial over coverage of Hogan's sex tape pitted the First Amendment against privacy rights — changing the world of tabloid fodder.

title.children: Hulk Hogan's greatest victory may have been inside a Florida courtroom

image.altText: Penny Wong walks smiling with man in front of Sydney Opera House

props.synopsis: Britain says it will deepen its AUKUS nuclear submarine partnership with Australia through a new 50-year treaty that it expects to create jobs and boost British exports.

title.children: UK and Australia deepen AUKUS submarine pact with 50-year treaty

image.altText: A house with police tape around it and an officer standing in front of it

props.synopsis: A man dies after suffering a medical episode minutes after being tasered during an arrest in the Perth suburb of Embleton overnight, WA police say.

title.children: Man dies after being tasered by police in suburban Perth

image.altText: A group of rugby league players in white and dark blue celebrate a try

props.synopsis: After scoring five tries in the first half, the Cowboys' errors and penalties let the Dragons right back into the contest in the second half. Follow live.

title.children: 'Are they dumb or what?' Error-riddled Cowboys invite Dragons back into game

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: THE DRAGONS GET THREE IN A ROW!
The Dragons go back to back!
The Dragons strike first in the second half!

image.altText: An Essendon AFL player reaches out to grab the ball as he is tackled from behind by a Western Bulldogs player.

props.synopsis: The Bulldogs look to keep up with the finals race against the Bombers, while the Giants and Swans meet for Harbour City bragging rights in the Sydney Derby. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Dons to face Dogs as seismic Sydney derby pits Giants against Swans

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: No late changes for Giants or Swans

image.altText: bride and groom kiss in the aisle of a flooded church

props.synopsis: A Filipino couple was undeterred by the extreme weather from tropical storm Wipha and chose to wade down the aisle in a flooded church.

title.children: Filipino couple get married in flooded church amid tropical storm Wipha

image.altText: Drone shot of trucks in the convoy lined up at Fraser Range.

props.synopsis: More than 80 trucks loaded with more than 6,000 bales of hay and straw from WA is heading for drought-stricken parts of South Australia.

title.children: 6,000 bales of hay make way to drought-striken farmers in SA

image.altText: An illustration of a hot pink bill with blue and black liquid pouring out

props.synopsis: Australia's pharmaceuticals watchdog is investigating a spike in reports related to Vyvanse, the country's most commonly prescribed ADHD medication.

title.children: Australia's most common ADHD drug has had a spike in adverse event reports

image.altText: Shop front of a disability employment provider office

props.synopsis: A national disability employment provider, which supports more than 6,000 Australians living with a disability, has lost federal funding, ABC News understands.

title.children: Major disability employment provider tells staff it has lost federal funding

image.altText: A person inserts a needle into an ampoule.

props.synopsis: A Victorian doctor who wrote up nearly 200 false exemptions in one week during the height of the pandemic has had his appeal against his suspension dismissed.

title.children: Doctor who handed out vaccine, mask exemptions has appeal dismissed

image.altText: Police officers stand next to a police car parked next to the driveway of a house

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the death of an elderly couple at a home in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Police investigate death of elderly couple at Melbourne home

image.altText: Pauline Hamill issues instructions during training, pointing her finger

props.synopsis: Former Scottish international player and long-time youth coach Pauline Hamill has been appointed coach of the Afghan women's refugee team.

title.children: FIFA announces first coach of Afghan women's refugee team

image.altText: Five man standing next two each other in a row and looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: After a week-long trial and more than 14 hours of deliberations, a jury has been unable to reach a verdict in the case of Petford Training Farm founder Geoff Guest on child sexual abuse charges dating back to the 1970s.

title.children: Jury discharged in sexual abuse trial of decorated youth camp founder

image.altText: A film still showing a man wearing a blue superhero suit and white gloves and a 4 on his chest in front of a wall of flames

props.synopsis: Marvel's first family is back on the big screen with a retro aesthetic, a star-studded cast and a hunger to wipe the superhero movie slate clean.

title.children: Fantastic Four fails to make Pedro Pascal a traditional movie star

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie

props.synopsis: The former Liberal Party staffer is facing two rape charges in Toowoomba, west of Brisbane, over an alleged incident in 2021 – to which he has yet to indicate a plea.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann drops claim over 'illegally obtained' phone calls

image.altText: A large sign saying Austin on the side of a grey building.

props.synopsis: A trainee surgeon at the Austin Hospital in Melbourne's north-east is charged with five further offences after being accused of covertly filming colleagues in a restricted staff toilet.

title.children: New charges for junior doctor who allegedly filmed colleagues in toilet

image.altText: Donald Trump and Jerome Powell in white hard hats, with Powell holding a paper

props.synopsis: The US Federal Reserve chair pushes back on President Trump's criticism of renovation costs amid a campaign of growing pressure.

title.children: Trump fact-checked by Federal Reserve boss in exchange over renovations

image.altText: Salim and Toufik Hamze

props.synopsis: Gangster Salim Hamze and his innocent father, Toufik, were killed in a hail of bullets getting into a red ute outside their family home in Guildford in 2021.

title.children: Man, teen boy in underworld murders of father and son were 'novices'

image.altText: An elderly man sitting outdoors, smiling warmly while wearing a light gray hoodie

props.synopsis: The Walkley Award-winning journalist has been remembered as a "wonderful human being" at a heartfelt funeral in North Sydney on Friday.

title.children: ABC journalist Peter Ryan remembered as 'lovely bloke' at Sydney farewell

image.altText: A close-up of a G4S logo on a fluorescent yellow vest, with the words: justice prisoner transport.

props.synopsis: Prison staff responsibilities in the NT are set to be privatised further, with Department of Corrections employees told the duties performed by private security firm G4S will be expanded.

title.children: NT expands role of private security guards to support packed watch houses

image.altText: A round, green and gold BP logo.

props.synopsis: The future of a renewable energy hub in Western Australia's Pilbara is in question after the majority shareholder backs out of the $55 billion project.

title.children: Uncertainty over renewable energy hub in Pilbara after BP backs out

image.altText: Ambulance vans on road with cars in background

props.synopsis: The man allegedly rammed a police vehicle and drove at the officers before two pursuit attempts and three cars were hit in Penrith.

title.children: Man arrested, critical incident declared after crash following police pursuit

image.altText: Close up of messy kitchen utensil drawer.

props.synopsis: When balancing taking care of your cookware and your health, what should you be looking for when buying cooking utensils?

title.children: Wood, metal or plastic? Choosing the best cooking utensils

image.altText: Tadej Pogačar, 2025 Tour de France, descending down a mountain

props.synopsis: Friday's Stage 19 of the Tour de France has been shortened after an outbreak of contagious nodular dermatitis in cattle near a climb forced authorities to cull livestock and restrict access to the area.

title.children: Cattle disease outbreak forces Tour de France route change
